## Overall Highlights

- Maduro celebrates Christmas in Venezuela, asserting that imperialism cannot defeat the nation.
- Venezuela claims overwhelming support from the UN Security Council amid US sanctions and military threats.
- The US has deployed special forces to the Caribbean, increasing military pressure on Venezuela.
- Russia and China criticize US actions towards Venezuela, framing them as intimidation and extortion.
- Venezuela's oil production reportedly reached 1.2 million barrels daily despite US sanctions.

<!--more-->

## Venezuelan Perspective (Venezuelan Sources)

- Maduro celebrates Christmas, stating that 'imperialism cannot defeat us'.
- Venezuela claims to have received 'overwhelming support' from the UN Security Council against US actions.
- Venezuela's Hydrocarbons Minister reports achieving a production target of 1.2 million barrels per day despite US blockades.
- Venezuela denounces US sanctions as colonial imposition and extortion.
- Russia and China express solidarity with Venezuela, criticizing US intimidation tactics.

## United States Perspective (United States Sources)

- The US defends its sanctions against Venezuela, labeling them necessary to counter Maduro's regime.
- US military forces have been deployed to the Caribbean to apply pressure on Venezuela amid ongoing tensions.
- The US condemns Venezuela's claims of UN support as propaganda, emphasizing its own stance on human rights and democracy.
- Reports indicate that the US has seized oil tankers linked to Venezuela, escalating tensions further.
- The US calls for dialogue and diplomacy while maintaining its military presence in the region.
